page.title: 10RECREATION IN STAMBOURNE 2
page.content: The Conservative Association holds a summer fete and a Village Supper. Whist drives take place in the village hall. Fund-raising events for the church, such as fetes, perform a social function. The Stambourne Singers, a small chamber choir, meet in the house of members living in Stambourne, but all the other members come from other villages. For all other leisure and recreation facilities, villages travel to nearby towns. The nearest sports centre and swimming pool is at Haverhill, cinema at Halstead, theatre at Sudbury. The major centres of Cambridge, Bury St. Edmunds, Colchester and Chelmsford are all about 25 miles away. There are no buses to or from Stambourne in the evenings.
